reviews.sentence: It was alright but would probably stay elsewere. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The accommodations were average and breakfast was not included in the price as it is in most motels today. Pool and spa was great and had some good conversation with other guest. I was visiting my daughter in Tucson for a few days and the location was adequate.

Staff was very nice great location close to shopping plus very easy to get around the city I would difently stay here again. The room was clean this hotel has a pool dining a bar I really enjoyed my stay.

Great stay. Such a great stay. We arrived in town early and were able to check in upon arrival. Philip was amazing in helping us determine which sights to see. The only reason I rated 45 is due to the cost of breakfast at the onsite restaurant. We will definitely stay here again. Comfortable rooms kind courteous staff and the pool area. More affordable breakfast options.

Great service and value. Pros Excellent staff service quiet rooms decent though not spectacular facilities like pool and fitness room. Very good food in the Vistas restaurant. Cons. Bland decor not enough illumination in rooms. Mediocre food in executive lounge though lots of fresh fruit.

Tucson with Hilton. The Hilton in Tucson is a great hotel with spectacular views of the mountains. The workout center pool and hot tub are great as well as the breakfast buffet. The restaurant is so so for dinner or lunch but the hotel is located close to many dining options and Cowboy town is not too far away. This is a great business hotel as well as a family place. I would recommend this Hilton property to anyone traveling to the Tucson area.
Great stay. Good pool and drinks. Only downer is that the rooms do not have refrigerators. But overall great place to stay.

Great stay in Tucson. Wife I stayed 5 nights end of March on vacation to visit family in area. We are Hilton Honors and AAA members. Stayed on 7th Club Level floor got daily full breakfast buffet vouchers at restaurant on 2nd floor AAA plus premium high speed internet in our package. The rate was very reasonable. The hotel looks to have been built about 30 years ago but is very clean modern looking both inside out. Room size is nice and the beds comfortable. The bathroom could be bigger. Not all rooms have a tub important to the Mrs so we had to have 2 queen beds in order to have a tub. I understand that the kings on the club level floor have showers. The carpets TV furniture etc. all were clean and in good working order. ALL the staff were VERY friendly and helpful. There are free USA Today WSJ papers in the lobby on weekday AMs. There is plenty of free parking and a very nice pool and hot tub outside however TOO cold for us Texans to swim. Housekeeping kept room spotless. Tub drain plug leaked and maintenance was knocking on the door to fix within 3 minutes of calling the front desk at 830 in the evening. AC unit like at many hotels was hard to regulate especially at night. Debie the manager was very professional and helpful. Very impressed with this hotel. We would highly recommend staying at this Hilton property.

First Time Guest can not Wait to Return. My husband and I spent two nights here in mid February. We booked a room on the executive level which included a two hour reception each night with appetizers and drinks as well as breakfast in the morning. It was great to be able to grab a quick bite and a cocktail in the evening on our way to or from our room. The room itself was clean and a decent size with a refrigerator and microwave which is always a must when we travel. I took advantage of the fitness center which had several machines and a nice view of the pool and hot tub area. We were also glad for the bar and restaurant where we could grab take out late and enjoy it back in our room. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed starting our days in the desert with the beautiful mountain views from the glass elevator and lobby. I miss that view and will stay here again the next time we are in Tucson.

Quality Hotel in Tucson. Our stay at Hilton Tucson East was very nice. Parking was good service was friendly and helpful room was clean and comfortable lots of amenities with pool fitness area wifi. The breakfast upgrade was meager with no protein options but overall this is a very nice hotel. We will definitely stay again when we return to Tucson.
Room was clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool area was very clean and relaxing. loved all of it.
Nice hotel. Spent most of the time at the pool with grandkids. Being renovated. So visually not quite what you had expect. Employees were all very courteous and helpful.

Best secrete in Tucson. Best Secret in Tucson. During a remodel the discounted price is incredible. The Hilton brand has not been affected. The quality of the room the food and staff are as you expect from the Hilton. What a wonderful idea for the hotel to offer such a discount while they are under construction. I did miss using the pool Jacuzi but for that price who can beat it. My friend was in the hospital close by so I stayed 2 separate times.
Fine. Nice place but major renovations in progress meant no bar no gift snack shop to speak of no pool. Wait a while before booking here.
Room was nice. Hotel was under renovations and the pool and workout areas are closed. This was not listed when reservation was made or would have went somewhere else very disappointing.

This is my second time here. At check I was not given my breakfast ticket. My coworker entered her room to find it was still dirty. At dinner I ordered a Jameson and halfway through realized there were GNATS in the drink. I told the waiter and waitress who apologized refusely yet still charged me 10 for a dirty drink floating with bugs. Dinner took about 30 minutes to hit the table for sandwich and a burger even though there were only 5 other tables sat. And to top it off the WiFi is out so I have to write this review using my data. Absolutely horrified at the level of service and will never stay here again.

Not a place you want to stay with kids. We had a stay cation here with our 2 kids. During our stay the pool was out or the lights were not on and we were told the Jacuzi was not working so swimming was out of the picture. We picked a time that there was a baseball tournament going on so there were older kids around which made it uncomfortable hotel was clean. We did not notice that there was no complementary breakfast so instead of eating at the hotel we traveled a couple blocks to eat at an Ihop. This was kinda an inconvenience on our part for not paying attention to the details and only picking this because the pool looked relaxing we never got to swim. For the price I would have chosen something with free breakfast.

Staycation. The room was great and the renovations a nice touch but cleanliness remains an issue. At 8 am the Fitness Center was dirty and probably had not been cleaned in awhile. The mirrors have not been cleaned in awhile the equipment was dirty and no cleaner available to wipe down equipment. A man came through in a white shirt and tie manager. yet an hour later ay 9 am garbage cans still full from night before tables left with beer bottles and towels scattered about. Looked like a big party the night before. Glass in the pool left me unable to the use the pool. The front desk said sorry. Really. I came to use the pool.

My stay was problematic and vey disappointing for a Hilton. Front desk person who checked us in was very helpful The elevators were not working properly. The womens restroom for the pool on the 2nd floor was not available for some unknown reason. The refrigerator was completely iced over and not working.

Hilton Flaws. Majority of the staff was pleasant though there were a few that when seeing I was no more than college age treated me with a more disgruntled attitude. I think it was in regard that they thought I was someones child and as such treated me so. On multiple nights there were noise incidents in the lobby of the hotel waking up multiple guest including me. One specific night a homeless individual came into the lobby high on some sort of drug and proceeded to create a loud distribution in the middle of the night breaking glass and several other itemsThe laundry room was out of service for the entirety of my stay which exceeded a month the only laundry service provided was dry cleaning in which it was 7 a shirt which is outrageous. Basic amenities should be provided for guest at a decent rate. Additionally in regards to amenities the first week I was there out of the only two elevators available for use one of them was broken and guest do not have access to the stairs unles it is a fire emergencyThere were flies everywhere in the lobby one could not sit down and read without multiple flies landing on them. Additionally the pool side has a huge bug problem as well.
The toilet was not very clean when we checked in. I had requested a room with easy access to the pool area and the room I was assigned was probably the farthest from the pool.

Pleasantly Surprised. This is a newly renovated hotel and is absolutely beautiful. The staff greets you as you walk in and are very prompt and helpful. I highly recommend this Hotel. the only drawback is the pool is very small.

Great stay. We stayed just one night though the hotel was clean nicely remodeled and staff was friendly. it is closest to the East entrance to Saguaro National Park. The heated pool and hot tub looked awesome though it was chilly when were there so we did not end up swimming.

Hope you like stairs. Elevator I was told has been broken for 5 months. Had to wait several times for a car we could fit in. Also the web site photos of the pool are misleading it is dinky. Hallways loud. No exhaust fan in bathroom. Really. Bed too hard for my liking and pillows useless fluff. On the positive Staff super friendly. Food was excellent and even a good house wine. Internet good tv good. Shower good. Views great.

Need to share some kudos. I am a Mariot Lifetime Titanium member and decided to try out this Hilton due to a co workers recommendation. Of course I called ahead for status match and told Hilton Gold would be 5 7 days which would have been too long. I decided to call the front desk and was accommodated by the front office manager. She upgraded me to the executive level on the top floor as well as my co worker. We enjoyed the free breakfast. I also wanted to give kudos to the restaurant manager Daren. I called ahead and told them I would be bringing in my own wine. Hilton Customer service checked and told me no corkage fee. There was some initial hassle until Daren stepped in and made things happen. that is what managers do and the customer is king. We were able to enjoy a tasty rib eye dinner cooked to perfection and pasta dish split over two people with our wine. I did workout at the gym and had to wait for the elliptical since only one was in the gym. Need improvement in this area and add at least one more. My co worker also received extra Hilton points because her AC too loud and TV remote batteries were not working at check in. I also asked ahead of time about a jacuzi and was told none. They do have a small jacuzi and nice to use after a hard day of business travel.
